text: The 1974 Arkansas gubernatorial election was held on November 5, 1974. Incumbent Democratic Governor Dale Bumpers retired to run for the U.S. Senate. Democratic nominee David Pryor defeated Republican nominee Ken Coon with 65.57% of the vote. ==Primary elections== Primary elections were held on May 28, 1974. ===Democratic primary=== ====Candidates==== *Orval E. Faubus, former Governor *David Pryor, former U.S. Representative for the 4th district *Bob C. Riley, incumbent Lieutenant Governor ====Results==== ===Republican primary=== ====Candidates==== *Ken Coon, executive director of the Republican Party of Arkansas *Joseph H. Weston, editor of the Sharp Citizen ====Results==== ==General election== ===Candidates=== *David Pryor, Democratic *Ken Coon, Republican ===Results=== ==References== ==Bibliography== * * * 1974 Arkansas Gubernatorial Category:November 1974 events in the United States
title: 1974 Arkansas gubernatorial election
